We refer to the figure provided in the question. The question is asking about incidence and prevalence of MS flares in the group of students. Incidence refers to the number of new cases of a disease in a population over a certain period of time, while prevalence refers to the total number of cases of a disease in a population at a given time. The figure does not provide information about the total population at risk, so we cannot calculate incidence or prevalence. However, we can see that 2 of the 6 patients had flares during the month of May, so the correct answer is (B): incidence during the month of May was 2.

We refer to the figure provided in the question. The figure shows a timeline from April 1 to June 30, and each row represents a patient with MS. Gray bars represent the duration of flares, and arrowheads indicate the presence of ongoing disease. Based on the figure, we can see that there were only 2 flares during the month of May (one in patient 1 and one in patient 3), so (B) is the correct answer. The incidence during April 1st to June 1st was 4, and the year-long prevalence was 5/6 (not including patient 5 who was in remission for the duration of the study). Prevalence of the disease on May 15 is not given in the figure, so (D) is incorrect.
